page.title: 18Education -Guyzance area
page.content: There are no schools within the survey area which means that all children have to travel to school from the age of five.State education is based on a three tier comprehensive system.The youngest children are collected by bus and taken to school in Acklington,a small village school with a falling roll.If this school closed the children would have further to travel.At 9 years children transfer to a middle school in Amble and at 13 years to a high school also in Amble.The school bus is the only bus serving the scattered community. Children leave home as early as 8.00am and arrive home after 4.00pm.Lack of transport makes it difficult for children to participate in extra curricular activities at school or youth clubs.
